title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.4 | 10-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: The topics leading to Pariksit Maharaj meeting Shukadeva Goswami and consequently Shukadeva Goswami spoke the Bhagavatam to Pariksit.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the context of the lecture, focusing on Pariksit Maharaj's encounter with Kali Yuga and its connection to the Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Pariksit is a Mahabhagavata, his birth is extraordinary, his activities are extraordinary and his passing away from this world is also extraordinary.
segments.summary: This segment describes Pariksit Maharaj's extraordinary qualities and his encounter with Kali Yuga, emphasizing the latter's low character and disguised appearance.

segments.key_quote: And this Kalipurusha's characteristic is that he is very, very low in his character, lower than a Shudra.
segments.summary: This segment details Kali Yuga's actions of hurting a cow and bull, and Pariksit Maharaj's immediate response to punish him.

segments.key_quote: His purpose in going out was to see how things were going on in terms of the godly state.
segments.summary: This segment explains the true purpose of a king's tour, which is to ensure the kingdom is aligned with the godly state and Krishna's will, not for self-aggrandizement.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the supreme controller, supreme lord of all planets, all universes.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes Krishna's supreme control and the king's duty to enforce dharma according to Krishna's codes, highlighting the characteristics of a God-conscious ruler.

segments.key_quote: Krishna wants to see that these two personalities or these two factors are always taken care. Go brahmana. The cows are protected and the brahmanas are protected.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the importance of cow protection and brahmanical culture for spiritual progress and the advancement of human civilization.

segments.key_quote: There is a miracle in milk, cow's milk. For it contains all the necessary vitamins to sustain human physiological conditions for higher achievements.
segments.summary: This segment explains the connection between cow protection and brahmanical culture, highlighting the benefits of cow's milk for developing sattva guna and advancing spiritual understanding.

segments.key_quote: The age of Kali means mismanagement and quarrel. And the root cause of all mismanagement and quarrel is that worthless men with the lower modes, who are situated in lower modes, who have no higher ambition in life, come to the helm of this state management.
segments.summary: This segment describes the characteristics of Kali Yuga, including mismanagement and the lack of cow protection due to unqualified leaders, and Pariksit Maharaj's intention to stop this decline.
